Description: Limestone ostracon: on the recto a scene in black ink depicting a monkey eating from a bowl filled with pomegranates. On the verso four incomplete lines of a legal text.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S.Quirke & J.Spencer (eds), British Museum Book of Ancient Egypt (London 1992), p.219, fig.169 For scenes with monkeys on ostraca cf. E. Brunner-Traut, 'Die altägyptischen Scherbenbilder’ (Wiesbaden, 1956), pp. 111ff.; J.Vandier d'Abbadie, , 'Revue d'Égyptologie' 18 (1966), pp. 198—9; J. Quaegebeur,'Les singes et la répresentation de leur pieds en Égypte ancienne', 'Acta Archaeologica Lovaniensia' 32 (Leuven, 1993), pp. 3-28.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136365) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136365)
Exhibition history: Exhibited 2013, Apr - Jul, Paris, Louvre, L'Art Du Contour 2013/2014, Sept - Jan, Musée royaux d’art et d’histoire, Brussels, L'Art Du Contour 2018 -2019, 6 Sep - 20 Jan, London, BM, G35, I Object
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
